intro: Collomia gracilis var. andicola, commonly known as the Andicola larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic environments. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. This variety is noted for its adaptability to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
